alert.note: Alert for Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nolan County through 630 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over I-20 Near The Nolan-Mitchell County Line, or near Champion, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roscoe, Champion, Wastella, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147, Us-84 Near The Nolan-Fisher County Line and I- 20 Near The Nolan-Mitchell County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 239. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
